npcs.name: Baron Eisflen
npcs.title: Illustrious Shopkeeper
npcs.lines: Oh, welcome back adventurer. Incase you didnt know before, i do have something of a shop set up in a small town not far from here, if you find me there ill be glad to sell even more than what i offer you in !store.
npcs.line: What can i do for ya?

dialogue.line1: Ah, you again is it? Ive been selling you items since you showed up here so dont you dare have forgotten me!
dialogue.line2: Well in any case this is my permanent shop, filled with much more goodies than the traveling one has.

dialogue.line1: You know, among us merchants there exists an old legend, of a treasure hidden somewhere in the Crator-Born Valley...
dialogue.line2: Ah! Well, its probably nothing but, you may want to have a good look around the crater-born valley, it seems something was left nehind..

dialogue.line1: Ah! I see you got the old treasure, to think it truly existed. Ya wouldnt mind handing a certain shopkeep a fee for pointing ya in that direction would ya?
dialogue.line2: Forgive me dear.. ah! forgive me i didnt see you there, what can i do for ya.

npcs.name: Miko of Valir
npcs.title: Shrine Maiden
npcs.lines: Ah.. adventurer, how merciful of the fates to guide you to me in this precarious situation. Should you allow it, there lies a village not far from here i wish to return to, please.. wont you guide me there?
npcs.line: Hm, what a righteous manner about you, wont you pray with me?

dialogue.line1: Oh heroic traveler, I never did express my gratitude. Here i have found a home, however i cannot allow you into the temple proper.
dialogue.line2: Its just simple remodeling, please abstain from heading past the ritual statues... I hope you understand.

dialogue.line1: So you return triumphant? .. As expected of a great hero.
dialogue.line2: Perhaps you have discovered an item or some such with emotional or spiritual meaning? If so the shrine can be a great place to meditate on it.
